meanings.definition: To provide someone with a set of tools or equipment.
meanings.sent1: The kind neighbor kitted the young boy with a toolbox for his woodworking project.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic kitted out the new apprentice with a complete set of wrenches and screwdrivers.
meanings.sent3: The camping trip was a disaster until the ranger kitted everyone with tents and sleeping bags.
meanings.sent4: The superhero kitted up with gadgets and gear before heading out to fight crime.
meanings.sent5: The teacher kitted the science lab with microscopes and test tubes for the students to use.

meanings.definition: To assemble or put together a set of items.
meanings.sent1: She kitted a delicious salad with fresh vegetables from the garden.
meanings.sent2: The children kitted a model airplane from a kit they received as a gift.
meanings.sent3: The team kitted a winning strategy for the championship game.
meanings.sent4: He kitted a puzzle together in record time.
meanings.sent5: The tailor kitted a beautiful dress for the fashion show.

meanings.definition: Dressed or equipped in a particular way.
meanings.sent1: The hiker was kitted in sturdy boots and a backpack for the mountain trek.
meanings.sent2: The astronaut was kitted in a spacesuit before the spacewalk.
meanings.sent3: The dog was kitted in a cute costume for the Halloween parade.
meanings.sent4: The knight was kitted in shining armor for the jousting tournament.
meanings.sent5: The chef was kitted in a crisp white uniform for the cooking competition.
